Description: Pennanular earring: consists of a cane of translucent dark-blue glass, circular in section, which has been drawn into an open-ended circle. The ends are drawn into two vertical loops. An opaque yellow cord encircles the outer circumference. Glossy surface.
Curator's comments: Pair with 1837,0717.125. Bibliography: Phillips Sale, 12 June 1837, Phillips Auction Rooms, London, lot 22.
